Name: Thomas Arnett
Book/Topic/Description: Clayton Christensen Institute / interviewed on LiberatED podcast
AI summary: K–12 education is seeing a rise in online learning options that prioritize student-centered approaches. Programs must decide whether to serve least-demanding consumers, who seek flexibility and customization, or nonconsumers, who require more support and resources. The success of these programs hinges on understanding the needs of their target audience, as serving both groups simultaneously can lead to ineffective models. Education leaders are urged to focus on the specific needs of the group they aim to serve to ensure effective innovation and support.
